### PR summary [69c4df83be](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19356/commits/69c4df83beb5224aaa0bb4aeb3d4c4e965941b5d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ aevalTower_ofNat`
`+ aeval_ofNat`
`+ eval_ofNat`
`+ evalâ‚‚_natCast`
`+ evalâ‚‚_ofNat`
`+ map_ofNat`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Shouldn't `_root_.map_natCast` simply be `@[simp]`?
I thought we were adding notes next to `no_index (OfNat.ofNat n)` lemmas to point to an explanation of that pattern

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by b-mehta.

> Shouldn't `_root_.map_natCast` simply be `@[simp]`?

There's nothing for `simp` to index on.

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

If there's nothing to index on, do you even want to keep the `TODO`s?

bors d+

If there's nothing to index on, do you even want to keep the `TODO`s?

bors d+
Should it not have `OfNat.ofNat n` on the RHS?

~~I think we're usually pretty sloppy about this; it only matters if someone tries to use the theorem with `simp` in reverse, and in this case it wouldn't work anyway because there's nothing to key on.~~

Sorry, I was talking about `no_index` on the RHS. You're correct.
I pushed a fix for this.
I added these TODOs; I think we should attempt this before merging this PR
The bench results don't look so good
